APS_BindReq_t Struct Reference

ZigBee spec r17: Table 2.6, page 34: Parameters structure of the APS_BindReq() function. Binding allows the next higher layer to request to bind two devices together, or to bind a device to a group, by creating an entry in its local binding table, if supported. More...

#include <aps.h>

APS_BindConf_t confirm

Detailed Description

ZigBee spec r17: Table 2.6, page 34: Parameters structure of the APS_BindReq() function. Binding allows the next higher layer to request to bind two devices together, or to bind a device to a group, by creating an entry in its local binding table, if supported.

Definition at line 519 of file aps.h.

Field Documentation

ExtAddr_t APS_BindReq_t::srcAddr

The source IEEE address for the binding entry.

Definition at line 522 of file aps.h.

Endpoint_t APS_BindReq_t::srcEndpoint

The source endpoint for the binding entry.

Definition at line 524 of file aps.h.

ClusterId_t APS_BindReq_t::clusterId

The identifier of the cluster on the source device that is to be bound to the destination device.

Definition at line 527 of file aps.h.

APS_AddrMode_t APS_BindReq_t::dstAddrMode

The addressing mode for the destination address used in this primitive. This parameter can take one of the non-reserved values from the following list: 0x00 = reserved 0x01 = 16-bit group address for DstAddr and DstEndpoint not present 0x02 = reserved 0x03 = 64-bit extended address for DstAddr and DstEndpoint present 0x04 . 0xff = reserved

Definition at line 535 of file aps.h.

APS_Address_t APS_BindReq_t::dstAddr

The destination address for the binding entry.

Definition at line 537 of file aps.h.

Endpoint_t APS_BindReq_t::dstEndpoint

This parameter will be present only if the DstAddrMode parameter has a value of 0x03 and, if present, will be the destination endpoint for the binding entry.

Definition at line 540 of file aps.h.

APS Bind confirm parameters structure.
